attributes.description: The map of attributes of this object; each attribute can be multi-valued.

dn.description: The Distinguished Name (DN) of the object, as the concatenation of its RDN (unique among siblings) and its parent's DN.

object_classes.description: The set of classes this object conforms to (e.g. organizationalUnit, inetOrgPerson).

select_attributes.description: Only attributes in this list will be modified by the provider

skip_attributes.description: A list of attributes which will not be tracked by the provider

attributes.description: The map of attributes to add to the referenced object; each attribute can be multi-valued.

dn.description: The Distinguished Name (DN) of the object, as the concatenation of its RDN (unique among siblings) and its parent's DN. The referenced object should exist to be able to add attributes.

block.description: The `ldap_object_attributes`-resource owns only specific attributes of an object. In case of multi-valued attributes the resource only owns the values defined by the resource and all pre-existing ones or ones added by other means are left in-tact.

attributes.description: The map of attributes of this object; each attribute can be multi-valued.

attributes_json.description: A map of json encoded attribute values. Each entry is a JSON encoded string list

depth.description: Search depth kind: sub (or subtree, wholeSubtree), base (or baseObject), one (or singleLevel)

search_values.description: A dict of values to search by, will be AND'd together

select_attributes.description: Only attributes in this list will be modified by the provider

skip_attributes.description: A list of attributes which will not be tracked by the provider
